meanings: to come true (of a dream, wish, etc.)

idioms.word: 棒ほど願って針ほど叶う
idioms.reading: ぼうほどねがってはりほどかなう
idioms.meaning: you can't always get what you want

lessons.japanese: あなたの夢が叶う日がきっと来るわ。
lessons.english: The day is sure to come when your dream will come true.

lessons.japanese: 夢が叶う日がきっと来るよ。
lessons.english: The day will surely come when your dream will come true.

lessons.japanese: もし病気の人が千羽の鶴を折ると、その人の願いが叶うの。
lessons.english: If a sick person folds one thousand paper cranes, her wish will come true.

lessons.japanese: もしも叶うなら、私は失った時間の埋め合わせをしたい。
lessons.english: If I could have a wish, I'd wish I could make up for lost time.

lessons.japanese: 長年抱いていた夢が必ずしも叶うとは限らない。
lessons.english: Long-cherished dreams don't always come true.

lessons.japanese: もし病気の人が千羽の鶴を折ると、その人の願いが叶うの。
lessons.english: If a sick person folds one thousand paper cranes, her wish will come true.

lessons.japanese: もしも叶うなら、私は失った時間の埋め合わせをしたい。
lessons.english: If I could have a wish, I'd wish I could make up for lost time.

lessons.japanese: 私の願いが叶うといいんだけど。
lessons.english: I wish my dream would come true.

lessons.japanese: 長年抱いていた夢が必ずしも叶うとは限らない。
lessons.english: Long-cherished dreams don't always come true.

lessons.japanese: いつか、願いは叶うでしょう。
lessons.english: Some day, your wishes will come true.
Someday my dream will come true.
Someday my dream will come true.

lessons.japanese: 私の願いが叶うといいんだけど。
lessons.english: I wish my dream would come true.
